bench.gen

Class GenValue

  • java.lang.Object
    • bench.gen.GenSegmentBase
      • bench.gen.GenValue
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GenSegment

    public class GenValue
extends GenSegmentBase
    Generates variable numeric values in String format. You configure the value generator with parameters of the processing instruction, which are passed to the initialize() method. Instructions are in the following format:

    <?;gen.value order=XXX min=MM max=NN factor=FF format=DDD ratio=R.r save=VVV ?>

      where XXX can be serial, random, context (default), or zipf
  MM is the minimum value to return (default 0)
  NN is the maximum value to return (default is DEFAULT_MAX_VALUE); (max - min) is used as a modulus for generated values
  FF is a factor by which the result will be multiplied (default 1)
  DDD is a valid java.text.DecimalFormat (default DFLT_FORMAT)
  R.r (if defined) is a floating point ratio by which the number will be multiplied, making the generated value floating point.
    • VVV is a new variable name where the current value will be stored for use by GenVariable. Notes: you can use the range=0to10by2 option instead of min/max/factor. A ratio can be specified to generate decimal and/or negative values, e.g. ratio=1.11 will create floating point results in a similar range to the computed integer values. When using a ratio, it is generally wise to also specify a more suitable format. The formulae generate using a Java 'long' type, limiting output to 9 or 10 digits; for longer strings (e.g. credit card numbers) split the string into two smaller parts.
Version:
TestHarness8.0
Author:
Progress Software Inc., all rights reserved.

      • decode

        public boolean decode(java.lang.String key,
             java.lang.String val)
        Initialize the segment with input parameters. The caller should pass in the attributes of the embedded processing instruction from the XML template. Local attribute values for this subclass include: format=XXX - where XXX is any valid DecimalFormat string
        Overrides:
        decode in class GenSegmentBase
        Parameters:
        key - An attribute name recognized by the segment type.
        val - The value of that attribute.
        Returns:
        true if the name/value pair can be decoded, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        DecimalFormat
